title: 8-year-old shooting victim in critical condition
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
BUFFALO, N.Y. (WIVB)- 8-year-old Donnell Bibbes underwent a second surgery at Women & Children’s Hospital Friday morning. Hospital officials said as of Friday afternoon he remained in critical condition.
“This is a senseless act of violence that leaves an 8-year-old fighting for his life,” said Mayor Byron Brown after meeting with the boy’s family.
The child was shot in the head Thursday night around 10 on South Division Street near Hickory and Pine Streets. Police told News 4 it occurred while Bibbes was visiting relatives in the area.
Bibbes was with his two older brothers and his mother at the time of the shooting. According to Buffalo Police Commissioner Daniel Derenda, one of the suspects ran up to the car and fired several shots at and inside the vehicle; 10-15 shots were fired.
Police were adamant Friday afternoon that this shooting was targeted, and likely an act of gang violence.
They believe one of Bibbes’ older brothers was like the intended target. Neither of the brothers or Bibbes’ mother were injured, according to Buffalo Police.
“We need people to come forward. We know there are people who witnessed this and we are not getting a lot of cooperation in these gang shootings. We need them to come forward and step up because this was a total senseless tragic act,” Commissioner Derenda said.
Derenda said solving gang related homicides and shootings usually poses a challenge, due to lack of cooperation from the community.
“A lot of the victims are suspects in other homicides, other shootings, so we don’t get cooperation from them or their friends.”
Bibbes mother, Chawniqua Johnson, released the following statement:
“Our family would like to thank everyone for their concern and prayers for Donnell. At this time, we have asked for our privacy. Please continue to pray for him as he fights to recover.”
Mayor Brown announced CrimeStoppers and the Buffalo Police Department are offering a $2,500 reward for anyone with information that leads to an arrest.
Anyone with any information about the shooting is urged to call the BPD Confidential Tipline at 847-2255.
